intro: Erophaca baetica subsp. baetica, commonly known as the Baetica erophaca, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. This subspecies is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
